case_title: M/S. Shama Exports (Pvt.) Ltd., Faisalabad vs Collector Of Sales Tax, Faisalabad

key_issues.issue: Scrutiny for verification of input tax
key_issues.finding: Rejection of refund on this ground is unlawful and beyond the scope of sales tax laws.
Rejection of refund during suspension of registration is premature and illegal.
Rejection of refund due to non-updating of automated system is unjustified.
Quadruplicate copy of shipping bill provided; objection vacated.
Claiming refund in succeeding tax period is permissible under section 7 of the Act.

legal_principles: Taxation statutes must be interpreted strictly based on clear and unambiguous language.
Executive orders or notifications cannot operate retrospectively if they adversely affect vested rights.
Procedural lapses should not result in denial of refund rights.
summary: The appeal filed by M/S. Shama Exports (Pvt.) Ltd. was accepted, and objections raised by the sales tax department were found to be unlawful or procedurally invalid. Refund claims were directed to be processed under the provisions of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
